poem:
### Transformations

Winter's chill,  
a flurry of guests,  
wine glasses clink  
in twilight's glow.

Across the room,  
a window vac hums,  
tidying shadows  
soft and low.

In this humble cocoon,  
we gather warmth  
like threads to weave  
our home's grace.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From wine glasses to window vacs: 50 easy ways to transform your home this winter The end of the year is drawing close, which means chilly weather and, if you’re in the hosting mood, a flurry of visitors (respect to anyone who has signed up to host a Christmas, and even more if you have in-laws coming). And then there’s all that tidying … It’s also the season for hunkering down and getting cosy. But". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
